column1: The Pinnath Gelin or Green Hills was a fief in the far west of Gondor
column2: bounded to the west by the River Lefnui
column3: and to the east by the Morthond.

column1: At the time of the War of the Ring
column2: the lord of this region was Hirluin. He led three hundred of his soldiers to the defence of Minas Tirith
column3: all dressed in green. Hirluin never went back to the Green Hills of his home - he was slain in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

column4: p. 525 (citing from the Unfinished index) the meaning of the name Pinnath Gelin would be actually closer to Green Ridges
column5: Green Slopes or Green Crests. The first word was the dialectical Sindarin or Gondor Sindarin pinnath. The second was the plural of the word calen
